oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SHOCK PRESSURE OF BREAKING WAVES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ross, Culbertson W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: laboratory testing
shock pressures
structure design
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Most of you have observed waves breaking against rocks or structures, and have noted that water is frequently thrown high in the air. The pressure required to project water in a vertical direction is about one half pound per square inch for each foot of height. We may therefore expect to find substantial pressure involved in the mechanics of a wave breaking against a structure.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 4 (1953): Proceedings of 4th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Chicago, Illinois, 1953.; 23
